sermons.title: (Covenant Word Ministries) Ask And It Shall Be Given You
(Education for Exultation) If the Lord Wills
04 Introduction Letter
sermons.description: Greetings in the precious Name of our Lord Jesus Christ. To all who are reading this book, called to be saints and beloved of God, grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. With such powerful modern movements of the Spirit such as the house Church Movement in China,20 the underground Church in North Korea, and the underground Church in Iran, we need to reevaluate the fruitfulness of the body of Christ in our countries.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 28 Principle 24 - Christ the Unity of the Body
sermons.description: Denominations, being splintered by slight shades of truth, are not pleasing to God, but rather grieve Him, though like a precious diamond we can see something good in every denomination.404 There is always some truth that one specific denomination knows, believes and preaches that is noteworthy and admirable for us to learn from. Yet overall it is not Godâ€™s perfect will for His body to be divided.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 32 Principle 28 - Examine Yourself and Correction in Love
sermons.description: In this age of technology when we get hurt it is easy to go to Facebook, or other social media to voice our feelings. For many of us having mercy or asking: Am I correct in feeling this way? can become an afterthought. Scripture reminds us to examine ourselves first. Judging, criticizing, maligning character, slandering and speaking to tear down another is probably one of the easiest things to do. Sadly, in the Christianity of our day such unedifying practices are applauded as righteous and discerning. Tearing down has become a ministry preoccupation with many in the blogosphere and Internet in general.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 43 Principle 39 - God Actually Answers Prayer
sermons.description: With many in the Church prayer is treated as the last thing we do before God. We use prayer to ask Him to fulfillâ€”in many casesâ€”our own carnal plans. With thousands of books written on prayer many of us have still not placed prayer as the most important Christian activity we do, corporately619 or privately.620 We have special times for prayer once in a while, expecting that God should hear us and then go back to our normal lives without an intense reliance on God through prayer.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 54 Principle 50 - Not Merely Listening
sermons.description: When we start reading the Bible based on our human wisdom we deny the faith and accuracy of Scripture. Without the guidance of the Holy Spirit men have been making up entire systems of beliefs with theological words that are used blasphemously and do not represent the truth nor the heart of God. We are then misled to believe that such humanistic doctrines carry â€œlife.â€ Life is not found in a theological system or interpretation; Life is found in Christ Jesus, surrendering to Him and allowing Him to live His Life through us. Thatâ€™s what it means to be â€œborn againâ€ or â€œborn of the Spirit.â€
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 69 Chinese House Churches Interview (by brother Denny)
sermons.description: This interview was conducted by brother Denny with two brothers who worked and are involved with the rural Chinese underground house Churches where God is doing a vibrant work. He has been building a pure pristine Book of Acts fellowship in House Church networks all over rural China. There is a simplicity to the move of God yet such fervency, love, and desire born in the hearts of these believers. We need to break out of the simple 1 hour church meeting patterns, and start to serve the Lord with full commitment like many of these precious brothers and sisters in the Lord. For many of us the questions and truths that are revealed are very important for us to hear as we gather under the Headship of Jesus Christ in local areas.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 76 Chronological Bible Reading of Scriptures
sermons.description: There is a great need in the body of Christ for consistent reading of the Holy Scriptures in their entirety, book by book, chapter by chapter, verse by verse. In this case we are encouraging a chronological reading of the Scriptures. Most of the confusion is created when certain teachers, groups, or denominations take singular verses out of context and compare them with others. Though it is a good spiritual principle to compare spiritual truths with spiritual truths,1139 yet this must all be done in the larger context of Godâ€™s Word. Therefore we are encouraging all of Godâ€™s saints to have a consistent discipline of reading through the whole Scriptures once a year as a supplemental reading plan.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: A Life of Effectual Intercessory Prayer
A Man After God's Own Heart
A Wake Up Call To Men In The Church
sermons.description: We are in desperate need of genuine leadership-broken, humble men-men who are not afraid to admit that they need God; men who are more worried about prayer than about status and recognition; men who petition God rather than position themselves. The state of the family today is disheartening. Men have largely forsaken their God-given role as spiritual leaders in their homesâ€¦that, no one can deny.

sermons.title: A Working Faith: Arrogant Presumption Exposed
BREAKING OF PROUD HEARTS
sermons.description: God enjoys helping His children and answering their prayers. However, sometimes He can’t intervene immediately. Why? We will be hearing in this meditation from someone who has experienced an answer to this question.

sermons.title: Be Patient, The Lord Is Coming - Part 1
Be Patient, The Lord Is Coming - Part 2
Be Ye Doers of the Word
Beware of the Angry Watchmen
sermons.scripture: Song of Solomon 2:1-10, James 1:14, Song of Solomon 5:6-7
sermons.description: October 28, 2007 - There is a false revival on the rise. It is the rise of the angry watchman who will cast stones at those who have gone astray from the Lord. This false revival consists of ministers who have led people away from the truth through legalism and a misguided prosperity gospel. They will forbid and command prodigals not to come into the presence of God until you work your way back into His favor through human effort and religion. We must not remove the veil from the bride of Christ. We have a righteousness that can not be taken away from us because Jesus is our veil.

sermons.title: Book of James
sermons.description: The sermon starts off with a reading of the entire book of James. Keith Daniel focuses mostly on one verse that he considers the heart beat of this entire epistle, James 4:5. Surely God is a jealous God for His people in our day; hear His call.

sermons.title: CHILD-LIKE PRAYER
sermons.description: Throughout the ages men have experienced that God is alive. Yes, when they turned to Him in prayer, God did hear and intervene. Their troubles were really changed! But perhaps you're asking, yourself, “How should I pray, so that I can experience His power in my life?” Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Christian Growth The Life of Brokenness
Confessions of a Pharisee
sermons.description: Alan Martin shares his heart with the work that God has been doing in showing area's of pharisaism. There are many hard teachings and doctrines in the Bible yet under all of these things the mercy and love of God are paramount. At times we can "choke" and "judge" others without mercy. May God give us the mercy and love of Christ in our Christian walks. A very searching sermon. Do we REALLY fulfill the royal law?  God is after the Pharisee in us, and it is His great mercy to do so to set us free.  The danger in being separated to God is to really think you know and judge others critically and keep others away at a distance because they're not as easy to get along with.

sermons.title: Double Minded Christians (àª—à«àªœàª°àª¾àª¤à«€ - Gujarati)
sermons.description: Brother Sherebyah speaks on the topic of Double-minded Christians. He speaks most of the message in the Indian language of Gujarati. May we be single-minded towards our Lord and not have any idols and other things which we put in the way. The Lord deserves our 100% for He purchased us with such a great price.

sermons.title: Effectual Fervent Prayer
sermons.description: Corrie Ten Boom shares some testimony on putting her burden's and cares on the Lord. Also she shares how she had burdens of impatience that she left with the Lord. "There is nothing too great for God's power and nothing to small for His love." This is a excellent teaching on many aspects of prayer.

sermons.title: Elijah - He Prayed
sermons.description: The life of this remarkable prophet was singled down into 2 words by God, "He Prayed". That phrase categorized his life and his marvelous exploits with God. Ravenhill walks us through the life of this man and paints a wonderful picture taking down most of our sunday school preconceptions.

sermons.title: Elijah and Other of Like Faith
Faith Made Complete
sermons.description: An expository teaching on James 2, covering the subjects of partiality and of faith and works. Partiality is showing preference to someone we feel comfortable around. Faith works. Very practical definitions are given to each of these subjects.

sermons.title: Finished with the World
sermons.description: There is something very potent and powerful about this message. Its one of Keith Daniels first visits to America and this message calls for a great consecration and call back to apostolic Chrisitanity in our daily practice. Are you finished with the world? Don't listen to this message unless you are willing to be impacted and changed in very powerul way.

sermons.title: God's Will About the Future
sermons.description: INTENDED FOR READING ON LORD'S-DAY, FEBRUARY 7TH, 1892, DELIVERED BY C. H. SPURGEON, AT THE METROPOLITAN TABERNACLE, NEWINGTON, ON THURSDAY EVENING, OCTOBER 16TH, 1890. “Go to now, ye that say, to day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain: whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapor, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away. For that ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this or that. But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil. Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.” — James 4:13-17 MEN today are just the same as when these words were first written. We still find people saying what they are going to do today, tomorrow, or in six months time, at the end of another year, and perhaps still further. I have no doubt there are persons here who have their own career mapped out before them pretty distinctly, and they feel well-nigh certain that they will realize it all. We are like the men of the past; and this Book, though it has been written so long, might have been written yesterday, so exactly does it describe human nature as it is at the end of this nineteenth century. The text applies with very peculiar force when our friends and fellowworkers are passing away from us. Sickness and death have been busy in our midst....

sermons.title: God’s War on Poverty and Riches
sermons.description: Calling attention to the unequal distribution of wealth in this fallen world, McGee observes that both poverty and riches are a curse to men. He exhorts the poor to avoid the pitfalls of sloth and laziness and to value hard work. He exhorts the wealthy to avoid the pitfalls of forming snobbish cliques in church, prideful attitudes, and indifference to the poor. He ends with reminding us from the book of Job, that God is thinking of the poor “in their affliction” and therefore so must we.

sermons.title: Gracious Speech
sermons.description: "The Body of Christ is being ripped apart by a bunch of truth speakers," laments Alan Martin.  Our report and observations of others around us may be accurate, but are they missing hope and faith?  Like Aaron our job is stand and bless not curse, and like Jesus to bear long with the infirmities of others, not accuse.  (NOTE: "A Pure Heart" is a follow-on to this sermon.)

sermons.title: Jesus Training The Twelve
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod powerfully shares on Jesus training the twelve disciples showing all the ways Jesus trained them. He shares many lessons for our walk with Jesus Christ daily in our day. Are you seeing your need before God today? For the Holy Spirit with prevailing prayer?

sermons.title: Jesus Training The Twelve (full service)
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod powerfully shares on Jesus training the twelve disciples showing all the ways Jesus trained them. He shares many lessons for our walk with Jesus Christ daily in our day. Are you seeing your need before God today? For the Holy Spirit with prevailing prayer?

sermons.title: Justification By Works
sermons.description: A look at Justification by works in the book of James as compared to Paul’s doctrine of “Justification by Faith.” McGee observed that Paul and James were not standing “face to face” contradicting each other, but rather standing “back to back” defending true biblical faith against two different foes. While Paul was affirming the power of real saving faith, James was criticizing the impotency of empty professing faith.  The sermon ends with Pauls’ exhortation. “Examine yourselves whether ye be in the faith.”  (Interesting side note: McGee claimed as inaccurate the familiar story that Martin Luther called James an “Epistle of straw”.)

sermons.title: Murmuring Against One Another
sermons.description: Alan Martin shares from a deep burden of seeing brothers yield to murmuring against one another.  This is such a plague in the body of Christ. It is unsettling to see so many lifes shipwrecked by carnal and critical words. Where is the fear of God like David had, where we pray "Lord put a watch over my mouth, and keep the door of my lips."  May the fear of the Lord come upon us all.

sermons.title: Persevering To Inheriting The Promise
sermons.description: A passionate message to encourage us to endure under lifes circumstances and persevere to the end. We are called to inherit the promise and hope to the end. Are we a persevering people that are "suffering long" and not sinning? Only those that inherit the promises are those that are persevering and suffering long against sin.

sermons.title: Power In Prevailing Prayer
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod shares on the subject of prevailing prayer, that the effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much. Praying that gets results and see God's work in this earth expand and grow. He exhorts us to have believing prayer pleading the exceeding precious promises to God.

sermons.title: Praying Church
sermons.description: Tozer shares many reasons why prayer should be utmost in the Church. He speaks with prophetic insight into much of the lack in his day and how prayer is the divine balm to heal this problem. If we are not we are straying. Never has the most important work been left to so few.

sermons.title: Preparing Your Heart to Receive the Truth
sermons.description: It is shared in this sermon that we need to take the time to prepare our hearts to receive the truth of God. The preparation is from God in proverbs, and yet it says sow to yourselves righteousness and break up your fallow ground. This sermon covers the need for people to have their hearts prepared to receive the truth to come into vital relationship with God.

sermons.title: Prevailing Prayer
sermons.description: In this message brother Gerhard shares his heart on a subject that characterizes his life. He breaks down some commonly help ideas of what prevailing prayer is, and shares many great stories and examples from great saints of God that had remarkable prayer communion times with the Lord. This message will stir your heart and confront you with the question, does the Lord want you to have a life of prevailing prayer?

sermons.title: Protection from the Power of Satan
Recognizing And Dealing With Occult Involvement
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod clearly deals with the subject of the occult in this message. He exposes much of the practices that Christians are involved in and shows how to get biblical deliverance. This is a great message to burn and hand out to those you feel could be involved in any areas of occult.

sermons.title: Redeemed from the Curse of the Law
sermons.description: This truth is one of the foundations of our faith in receiving blessing from the Lord. Some have called this truth the believer's Emancipation Proclamation.

sermons.title: Resist The Devil
sermons.description: Mark Greening shares on spiritual warfare and resisting the work of the devil in Christian life. He debunks some of the false concepts of spiritual warfare that have crept in the Church and shows how the Church has departed from scripture in this area.

sermons.title: Resist The Devil by Mark Greening
sermons.description: Mark Greening shares on spiritual warfare and resisting the work of the devil in Christian life. He debunks some of the false concepts of spiritual warfare that have crept in the Church and shows how the Church has departed from scripture in this area.

sermons.title: THE WAY IS PREPARED
sermons.description: Distress and darkness in our lives and the world today need not remain there. What a joyful message!  God has prepared a way out. This meditation will tell about the great and exciting promise this truth holds for each of our lives. Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Tame Your Tongue
sermons.description: Preaching out of the book of James, David Wilkerson preaches on the power and evil of the small piece of red matter that lies between our teeth.  With its tiny spark, entire forest can be and are destroyed.  This is speaking of Christian believers and not the world.  This is a vitally serious matter, which is not often talked about throughout the church today.

sermons.title: Tear Down the Strongholds
sermons.description: This message discusses satanic strongholds and the place they have in our lives. The bondages of fear and curses are also addressed.

sermons.title: The Blessing of Obedience
sermons.description: We all have some area that we struggle with, but there is a blessing to obeying Jesus. Ephesians 1:17; James 1:22-25; Psalm 119:145-146

sermons.title: The Book of James
sermons.description: The author of this letter introduces himself as "James, a servant of God and the Lord Jesus Christ". Four men in the New Testament bore this name but the writer of this Epistle is usually identified with James who was the leader of the church in Jerusalem. The letter is addressed to the "the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad", and is the most Jewish in style and form of any of the New Testament books. It is not a treatise on Christian theology but rather a practical letter dealing with Christian ethics. James insists that works, not words, are the mark of a disciple.

sermons.title: The Call For Multiplying House Churches
sermons.description: Brother E.A. Abraham shares his testimony of being fruitless in ministry for 10 years and then the Lord started to do the work seeing thousands come to the Lord in Bihar, India. He encourages house churches in the West to share the Gospel and see house churches multiply and disciples made. He speaks on James 1:22 that we need to obey the Lord and the great commission.

sermons.title: The Day Jesus Was Astonished
sermons.description: The centurion proves to be a type of a Christian who cares about people. It astonishes our Lord to see this man's faith-a man who was in authority, yet cared this much for a servant.  He had power yet he recognized the power of the Master. He also saw his own unworthiness in comparison to our Lord.

sermons.title: The Glory Of God - Part 3
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 06/01/1966. The glory of God is expressed in the trinity. God the Father is the source of glory. The Father takes personal responsibility for His children to bring them unto glory. Jesus Christ is the Lord of glory. He is the One that is in control to bring forth the glory of God. Jesus Christ is faithful to bring forth all of our adverse circumstances to work for His glory. The Holy Spirit is the Spirit of glory. The Spirit of glory can take hold of the things that would be to our own undoing and turn them for the glory of God.

sermons.title: The Great Need Of Revival by Denny Kenaston
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston opens the revival conference with a exhortation to seek the face of God, to see what God can do! He shares the burden and reason why revival is very needful in our day. Then he preaches verse by verse through psalm 80 asking God to restore his church to God.

sermons.title: The Law and the Commandments
sermons.description: We have not understood the absoluteness of the moral requirements of God, nor are we emphatic about performing them by the grace that God Himself is only too willing to give.

sermons.title: The Pigs In The Parking Lot
sermons.description: Prepare to be convicted if you are holding back on God. Luke 8:27-40. Jesus is met by a possessed man in the Gadarene tombs, who has many devils, and they with fear and trembling (James 2:19) beg Jesus to let them go into a nearby herd of pigs, rather than banish them to the pit, and he allows them to go. When the man  is found by the neighboring citizens, clothed and sitting at the feet of Jesus in his right mind, instead of rejoicing at his deliverance, they reject Jesus, and ask him to leave for they are unwilling to follow him if it means losing their pigs. Many are unwilling to trust their life to Jesus, and are holding back part of themselves, unwilling to surrender, having counted the cost and the price too high. If you are happy with average, this message isn't for you. If you are determined to follow Jesus, wholly,  listen with an open heart.

sermons.title: The Power And Danger Of The Tongue
The Price of Revival
sermons.description: Ravenhills timeless messages will always keep you on your feet no matter where you are spiritually. They never get old. In this message he speaks on Old Testament characters with an eye opening perspective. This word comes with the sharp, smashing, shattering, and sobering reality of the truth that will bring you to your knees if you let it.

sermons.title: The Purpose of Trials
sermons.description: A message that explores the primary reason why God allows different fiery trials and temptations to afflict a saint. Learn how to prepare for tests and progress in the school of God. The preacher seeks to communicate the deep practicality of God's refining process in the hearts of His people.

sermons.title: The Tongue
sermons.description: The wisdom and grace that enables a man to bridle his tongue will be the same wisdom and grace that will enable him to control his actions, attitudes and whole life. A changed tongue is found only in changing the source. No man can tame the tongue—but the Lord can! This message is full of practical teaching.

sermons.title: They Have Done Away With The Cross
Tongue Taming
sermons.description: David Murray shares from the Heidelberg Catechism on the tongue and the sins of the tongue. He very carefully goes through many of the warnings in scriptures of the wrong use of the tongue and encourages us to use the tongue rightly by the Spirit of God.

sermons.title: What is Worldliness?
sermons.description: McGee asks the question “What is Worldliness?” He begins his answer by first dismissing some of the more popular answers such as carnal amusement, running with wrong people, inappropriate dress, preoccupation with money, and neglecting the church. Instead, true worldliness is the jealousy, the pride, the rivalries, and the selfish ambitions we invite into our churches. The sermon ends with a call for renewed consecration to God and humble communion with one another.

sermons.title: What is your Life?
sermons.description: A scriptural reminder that this life is brief and uncertain. Yet in a world of uncertainty McGee reminds believers they can be sure of their salvation!  Paul’s words are used to sum up this certainty in Jesus Christ: “I know whom I have believed, and I am pursuaded that he able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.” The sermon ends with the simple profound invitation. “Come now.”

sermons.title: Who Is a Wise Man?
sermons.description: Does your walk talk what your talk talks? Wisdom is seen in the fruit of a life. A clear teaching on heavenly wisdom versus earthly wisdom from verses 13-18 in James 3.

sermons.title: Why God Waits
sermons.description: There are things that the Lord asks us to do that we would not want to do. God desires to do things in our lifes that we would never life different otherwise. God wants to transform us into the image of Christ. We need to submit and humble ourselves before Him.
